001package io.github.ai4ci.util;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.InputStream;
005import java.io.ObjectInputStream;
006import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
007import java.io.OutputStream;
008import java.io.Serializable;
009
010import org.apache.commons.lang3.SerializationUtils;
011
012/**
013 * Utility for performing deep object copying via serialisation.
014 * <p>
015 * This class provides high-performance deep copy functionality using custom
016 * byte stream implementations that avoid synchronisation overhead.
017 * <p>
018 * Unlike shallow copies produced by {@link Object#clone()}, deep copies ensure
019 * complete independence between original and copied objects by serialising the
020 * entire object graph.
021 * <p>
022 * Performance characteristics include:
023 * <ul>
024 * <li>Custom buffering with geometric growth: use {@code b_{n+1} = max(s,
025 * 2*b_n)}</li>
026 * <li>Stream operations without synchronisation overhead</li>
027 * <li>Size estimation for optimal buffer pre-allocation</li>
028 * </ul>
029 * <p>
030 * All serialised objects must implement {@link Serializable} to ensure
031 * compatibility with the underlying Java serialisation mechanism.
032 *
033 * @author Rob Challen
034 * @see java.io.Serializable
035 * @see org.apache.commons.lang3.SerializationUtils
036 */
037public class Cloner {
038
039        /**
040         * High-performance byte array input stream without synchronisation overhead.
041         * <p>
042         * This implementation provides efficient read access to byte arrays with
043         * mathematical guarantees about stream behaviour. The stream maintains
044         * position tracking and buffer boundary validation.
045         * <p>
046         * Array read operations follow the specification in code form.
047         *
048         * @author Rob Challen
049         * @see java.io.ByteArrayInputStream
050         */
051        public static class FastByteArrayInputStream extends InputStream {
052
053                /**
054                 * Source byte array buffer.
055                 */
056                protected byte[] buf = null;
057
058                /**
059                 * Total readable bytes in buffer.
060                 */
061                protected int count = 0;
062
063                /**
064                 * Current read position.
065                 */
066                protected int pos = 0;
067
068                /**
069                 * Constructs stream with specified buffer and valid data length.
070                 *
071                 * @param buf   source byte array containing data
072                 * @param count number of valid bytes in buffer
073                 */
074                public FastByteArrayInputStream(byte[] buf, int count) {
075                        this.buf = buf;
076                        this.count = count;
077                }
078
079                /**
080                 * Returns number of bytes available for reading.
081                 *
082                 * @return remaining bytes to read
083                 */
084                @Override
085                public final int available() {
086                        return this.count - this.pos;
087                }
088
089                /**
090                 * Reads single byte, advancing position.
091                 *
092                 * @return byte value 0-255 or -1 at end of stream
093                 */
094                @Override
095                public final int read() {
096                        return (this.pos < this.count) ? (this.buf[this.pos++] & 0xff) : -1;
097                }
098
099                /**
100                 * Reads byte array slice with boundary validation.
101                 *
102                 * @param b   destination array
103                 * @param off destination offset index
104                 * @param len maximum bytes to read
105                 * @return actual bytes read or -1 if stream exhausted
106                 */
107                @Override
108                public final int read(byte[] b, int off, int len) {
109                        if (this.pos >= this.count) return -1;
110
111                        if ((this.pos + len) > this.count) { len = (this.count - this.pos); }
112
113                        System.arraycopy(this.buf, this.pos, b, off, len);
114                        this.pos += len;
115                        return len;
116                }
117
118                /**
119                 * Skips specified number of bytes with boundary checking.
120                 *
121                 * @param n number of bytes to skip
122                 * @return actual bytes skipped
123                 */
124                @Override
125                public final long skip(long n) {
126                        if ((this.pos + n) > this.count) { n = (this.count - this.pos); }
127                        if (n < 0) return 0;
128                        this.pos += n;
129                        return n;
130                }
131
132        }
133
134        /**
135         * High-performance byte array output stream with geometric buffer growth.
136         * <p>
137         * This implementation avoids method synchronisation and provides efficient
138         * memory management through geometric buffer expansion. Write operations
139         * maintain array integrity through verified buffer sizing. System array copy
140         * operations ensure efficient data movement with O(n) complexity.
141         *
142         * @author Rob Challen
143         * @see java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream
144         */
145        public static class FastByteArrayOutputStream extends OutputStream {
146
147                /**
148                 * Internal buffer array excluding synchronisation overhead.
149                 */
150                protected byte[] buf = null;
151
152                /**
153                 * Current data size within buffer.
154                 */
155                protected int size = 0;
156
157                /**
158                 * Constructs stream with default 5KB buffer capacity.
159                 */
160                public FastByteArrayOutputStream() {
161                        this(5 * 1024);
162                }
163
164                /**
165                 * Constructs stream with specified initial buffer size.
166                 *
167                 * @param initSize initial buffer capacity in bytes
168                 */
169                public FastByteArrayOutputStream(long initSize) {
170                        this.size = 0;
171                        this.buf = new byte[(int) initSize];
172                }
173
174                /**
175                 * Returns underlying byte array containing written data.
176                 * <p>
177                 * Note: array capacity typically exceeds actual data size due to
178                 * geometric allocation strategy.
179                 *
180                 * @return buffer array
181                 */
182                public byte[] getByteArray() { return this.buf; }
183
184                /**
185                 * Creates input stream for reading stored data.
186                 *
187                 * @return FastByteArrayInputStream positioned at buffer start
188                 */
189                public InputStream getInputStream() {
190                        return new FastByteArrayInputStream(this.buf, this.size);
191                }
192
193                /**
194                 * Resets stream to initial empty state.
195                 * <p>
196                 * Buffer memory retained.
197                 */
198                public void reset() {
199                        this.size = 0;
200                }
201
202                /**
203                 * Returns current data size in bytes.
204                 *
205                 * @return number of bytes written to stream
206                 */
207                public int size() {
208                        return this.size;
209                }
210
211                /**
212                 * Ensures buffer capacity meets or exceeds required size.
213                 *
214                 * @param sz minimum required buffer size
215                 */
216                private void verifyBufferSize(int sz) {
217                        if (sz > this.buf.length) {
218                                byte[] old = this.buf;
219                                this.buf = new byte[Math.max(sz, 2 * this.buf.length)];
220                                System.arraycopy(old, 0, this.buf, 0, old.length);
221                                old = null;
222                        }
223                }
224
225                /**
226                 * Writes complete byte array with geometric buffer expansion.
227                 *
228                 * @param b source byte array with length
229                 */
230                @Override
231                public final void write(byte b[]) {
232                        this.verifyBufferSize(this.size + b.length);
233                        System.arraycopy(b, 0, this.buf, this.size, b.length);
234                        this.size += b.length;
235                }
236
237                /**
238                 * Writes byte array slice with bounds verification.
239                 *
240                 * @param b   source array
241                 * @param off starting offset
242                 * @param len number of elements
243                 */
244                @Override
245                public final void write(byte b[], int off, int len) {
246                        this.verifyBufferSize(this.size + len);
247                        System.arraycopy(b, off, this.buf, this.size, len);
248                        this.size += len;
249                }
250
251                /**
252                 * Writes single byte with minimal buffer expansion.
253                 *
254                 * @param b byte value to write
255                 */
256                @Override
257                public final void write(int b) {
258                        this.verifyBufferSize(this.size + 1);
259                        this.buf[this.size++] = (byte) b;
260                }
261
262        }
263
264        /**
265         * Stream implementation for size estimation without actual data storage.
266         * <p>
267         * This mock stream tracks cumulative bytes written without storing data,
268         * providing memory-efficient size estimation.
269         *
270         * @author Rob Challen
271         * @see java.io.OutputStream
272         */
273        public static class MockOutputStream extends OutputStream {
274
275                private long size = 0;
276
277                /**
278                 * Returns the cumulative size of all write operations.
279                 *
280                 * @return the accumulated size estimate
281                 */
282                public long size() {
283                        return this.size;
284                }
285
286                /**
287                 * Records a complete byte array write operation.
288                 *
289                 * @param b the byte array being written
290                 */
291                @Override
292                public final void write(byte b[]) {
293                        this.size += b.length;
294                }
295
296                /**
297                 * Records a slice of byte array write operation.
298                 *
299                 * @param b   the source byte array
300                 * @param off the starting offset in the array
301                 * @param len the number of bytes to count
302                 */
303                @Override
304                public final void write(byte b[], int off, int len) {
305                        this.size += len;
306                }
307
308                /**
309                 * Records a single byte write operation.
310                 */
311                @Override
312                public void write(int b) throws IOException {
313                        this.size += 1;
314                }
315        }
316
317        /**
318         * Creates a deep copy of a serialisable object using optimised buffers.
319         * <p>
320         * This method provides a convenient interface for deep copying objects with
321         * automatic size estimation and optimised buffer management.
322         *
323         * For objects larger than \[ 2^{31}-8 \] bytes, the method delegates to
324         * {@link SerializationUtils#clone(Serializable)} for safety.
325         *
326         * @param <X>  the type of object being copied, must extend Serializable
327         * @param orig the original object to copy
328         * @return a deep copy of the original object
329         * @throws RuntimeException if serialisation process fails
330         */
331        public static <X extends Serializable> X copy(X orig) {
332                return copy(orig, 128 * 1024 * 1024);
333
334        }
335
336        /**
337         * Creates a deep copy with explicit size estimation for optimal performance.
338         * <p>
339         * This method provides a memory-efficient deep copy operation with optimised
340         * buffer allocation using the estimated size. The buffer size is calculated
341         * as 110% of the estimated size to balance between memory usage and the
342         * likelihood of needing to resize during serialisation, as empirical testing
343         * suggests that where buffer over-allocation by 10% minimises re-sizing
344         * overhead.
345         *
346         * @param <X>           the serialisable object type
347         * @param orig          object to copy
348         * @param estimatedSize estimated serialisation size for buffer optimisation
349         * @return independent deep copy of original object
350         * @throws RuntimeException on serialisation errors
351         */
352        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
353        public static <X extends Serializable> X copy(X orig, long estimatedSize) {
354                if (estimatedSize > Integer.MAX_VALUE - 8)
355                        return SerializationUtils.clone(orig);
356                X obj = null;
357                try {
358                        // Write the object out to a byte array
359                        FastByteArrayOutputStream fbos = new FastByteArrayOutputStream(
360                                        (long) (estimatedSize * 1.1)
361                        );
362                        ObjectOutputStream out = new ObjectOutputStream(fbos);
363                        out.writeObject(orig);
364                        out.flush();
365                        out.close();
366
367                        // Retrieve an input stream from the byte array and read
368                        // a copy of the object back in.
369                        ObjectInputStream in = new ObjectInputStream(fbos.getInputStream());
370                        obj = (X) in.readObject();
371                } catch (IOException | ClassNotFoundException e) {
372                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
373                }
374                return obj;
375        }
376
377        /**
378         * Estimates serialisation size without storing actual data.
379         * <p>
380         * This method calculates the estimated byte count required to serialise an
381         * object.
382         * <p>
383         * The estimation employs a MockOutputStream that tracks size without data
384         * storage, providing memory-efficient size prediction for buffer allocation
385         * optimisation in subsequent copy operations.
386         *
387         * @param obj object to estimate serialisation size for
388         * @return estimated bytes required for serialisation \[ \geq 0 \]
389         * @throws RuntimeException if serialisation fails during estimation
390         */
391        public static long estimateSize(Object obj) {
392                long objSize = 0;
393                try {
394                        MockOutputStream baos = new MockOutputStream();
395                        ObjectOutputStream oos = new ObjectOutputStream(baos);
396                        oos.writeObject(obj);
397                        oos.close();
398                        objSize = baos.size();
399                        baos.close();
400                } catch (IOException e) {
401                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
402                }
403                return objSize;
404        }
405
406}
